# How to Custom Admin Menu Icon

1. Download `.svg` file 
2. Write `'data:image/svg+xml;base64,'`
3. Open the svg file into VS Code.
4. Copy everything in the clipboard
```
<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
<path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M10 20C15.5229 20 20 15.5229 20 10C20 4.47714 15.5229 0 10 0C4.47714 0 0 4.47714 0 10C0 15.5229 4.47714 20 10 20ZM11.99 7.44666L10.0781 1.5625L8.16626 7.44666H1.97928L6.98465 11.0833L5.07275 16.9674L10.0781 13.3308L15.0835 16.9674L13.1716 11.0833L18.177 7.44666H11.99Z" fill="#FFDF8D"/>
</svg>
```
4. Open up the dev tools in the **Google Chrome** 
5. Go to "Console"
6. Write `btoa(``)`
7. Inside the backtick(``), past the clipboard
```
btoa(`<svg width="20" height="20" viewBox="0 0 20 20" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
<path fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" d="M10 20C15.5229 20 20 15.5229 20 10C20 4.47714 15.5229 0 10 0C4.47714 0 0 4.47714 0 10C0 15.5229 4.47714 20 10 20ZM11.99 7.44666L10.0781 1.5625L8.16626 7.44666H1.97928L6.98465 11.0833L5.07275 16.9674L10.0781 13.3308L15.0835 16.9674L13.1716 11.0833L18.177 7.44666H11.99Z" fill="#FFDF8D"/>
</svg>`)
```
8. Result will be showing as below:
```
''
```
9. Except single quotes(''), copy that into the clipboard
10. Attach it into the clipboard
```
'data:image/svg+xml;base64,'
```

Final Example:
```php
function ourMenu() {
    add_menu_page('Words To Filter', 'Word Filter', 'manage_options', 'ourwordfilter', array($this, 'wordFilterPage'), 'data:image/svg+xml;base64,', 100);
}
```

## Resource
[Udemy | Become a WordPress Developer: Unlocking Power With Code](https://www.udemy.com/course/become-a-wordpress-developer-php-javascript/)
